title: CK Akunnor reveals maturity as he prepares to make Ghana Premier League return with Dreams FC
text:
Sports News | 21 October 2015 12:55 CET CK Akunnor reveals maturity as he prepares to make Ghana Premier League return with Dreams FC - www.ghanasoccernet.com 
The ex-Ghana international endured a difficult start to coaching when he was sacked by Hearts after less than a season in charge. 
The former Eleven Wise trainer says he's grown in his chosen profession as he prepares to return to the Ghanaian top-flight. 
“I have learnt a lot especially at Hearts of Oak. I was in a situation where I was with my technical and whilst we are talking they are recording me secretly,” the ex-Ghana skipper told Joy FM. 
“You saw it happened to one of the players. It is crazy for you to have realised this was happening; people that you brought some of them on board and they look for your downfall because they’ve told to something you can’t tell. 
“These are the little things that deepens the team. Talking of Dreams (FC) I have my technical team alright. You cannot trust everybody but there’s focus there’s togetherness. No body ia going sideways or to a different direction we are all going towards one direction.” 
Akunnor, a former captain of the Black Stars, has been busy in the transfer market, buying players to augment his squad ahead of his side's debut season.
